CIPHER.288.cipherString: Never give up on what you really want to do. The person with big dreams is more powerful than one with all the facts.
CIPHER.288.question: Solve this Aristocrat encoded quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.

CIPHER.298.cipherString: Advertising: the science of arresting the human intelligence long enough to get money from it.
CIPHER.298.question: Solve this Aristocrat which is a quote by Stephen Leacock.

CIPHER.293.cipherString: If you formulate your question properly, mathematics gives you the answer
CIPHER.293.question: Figure out what these strange headlines encoded using a Baconian alphabet mean.  It was said by Savas Dimopoulos and starts out with IF YOU. What does it say?

CIPHER.290.cipherString: All these observations fascinate us, and fill us with an intense desire to know more about the nature of these phenomena.
CIPHER.290.question: Solve this Patristocrat which is a quote by Nikola Tesla encoded using a K1 alphabet.

CIPHER.294.cipherString: Wonder is the seed of knowledge
CIPHER.294.question: Encode this phrase from Francis Bacon (yes, the one who invented the Baconian Cipher) using the Affine cipher with a=11 and b=21.

CIPHER.300.cipherString: How satisfying it is to leave a mark on a blank surface. To make a map of my movement - no matter how temporary.
CIPHER.300.question: Decode this quote by Craig Thompson which has been encoded using a Baconian cipher.

CIPHER.303.cipherString: Neither a man nor a crowd nor a nation can be trusted to act humanely or to think sanely under the influence of a great fear.
CIPHER.303.question: Solve this Patristocrat which is a quote by Bertrand Russell that has been encoded with a K2 alphabet and starts with NEIT.

CIPHER.305.cipherString: I'll try anything once, twice if I like it, three times to make sure.
CIPHER.305.question: Encode this phrase by Mae West using Vigenère cipher with a keyword of TIMES.

CIPHER.296.cipherString: One morning I shot an elephant in my pajamas. How he got in my pajamas I'll never know.
CIPHER.296.question: Encode this phrase by Groucho Marx using a Caesar cipher with a shift of 10.  I.e. A is encoded as K.

CIPHER.297.cipherString: El amor a la naturaleza es algo diferente del amor a la ciencia, aunque los dos pueden ir juntos.
CIPHER.297.question: Solve this Xenocrypt in Spanish which is a quote by John Burroughs that has been encoded with a K1 alphabet using an English keyword.
CIPHER.297.translation: The love of nature is a different thing from the love of science, though the two may go together.

CIPHER.289.cipherString: You move forward. You face up to your challenges. You don't retreat. You're young, and sometimes you'll wish you could. But don't.
CIPHER.289.question: Decode this phrase by Ellyn Bache which has been encoded using the Atbash Cipher.

CIPHER.295.cipherString: Eye off ten considered weather their cold perhaps bee found a more reasonable arrangement of circles.
CIPHER.295.question: Solve this Aristocrat which is a observation by Nicolaus Copernicus, very badly mangled by Alexa and then encoded with a K1 alphabet.

CIPHER.302.cipherString: Never express yourself more clearly than you are able to think.
CIPHER.302.question: Decode this phrase by Niels Bohr which was encoded with with the Vigènere cipher using the keyword MUSIC.

CIPHER.306.cipherString: Fantasy is a necessary ingrediant inn living, its a weigh of looking at lief threw teh rong end of a telescope.
CIPHER.306.question: Solve this Aristocrat encoded quote by Dr. Seuss which was misheard and then typed in with mistakes before being encoded with a K2 alphabet.

CIPHER.301.cipherString: You shouldn't think about the past so much...Looking back only gives you a stiff neck.
CIPHER.301.question: Decode this phrase by Jens Christian Grøndahl which has been encoded using a Caesar Cipher.

CIPHER.304.cipherString: It’s humbling to think that all animals, including human beings, are parasites of the plant world.
CIPHER.304.question: Solve this Aristocrat which is a quote by Isaac Asimov containing the word THAT.

CIPHER.292.cipherString: If you are lazy, and accept your lot, you may live in it. If you are willing to work, you can write your name anywhere you choose.
CIPHER.292.question: Encode this phrase by Gene Stratton-Porter using the Atbash Cipher.

CIPHER.299.question: Using a key of PINT, compute the decryption matrix for a 2x2 Hill cipher using a 26 character alphabet.

CIPHER.291.cipherString: Human beings can easily destroy every elephant on earth, but we are helpless against the mosquito.
CIPHER.291.question: Solve this Aristocrat which is a quote by Isaac Asimov which starts with the word HUMAN.
